website_summaries.verdict: A high-end survival machete that is expertly crafted for long-lasting durability.
pros: Stainless steel construction guarantees the machete can withstand harsh weather conditions
Dual-edged machete includes a straight-edge blade on one side and an 18" saw back serrated blade on the opposite side
Serrated edge can be used as saw
Rubber handle provides a comfortable grip
Spiked tang on the back of the handle is ideal for pounding or scraping
cons: Grip does not include any finger grooves
Machete is flimsy in comparison to similar options

customer_reviews.title: Weak blade
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. After cutting a few branches down with my chainsaw I desided to use this beauty to take the small branches off them. None of the branches were larger than an inch and this is the result.
customer_reviews.author: jake vogel

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish
customer_reviews.text: This is complete garbage. The grip texture feels awful, the blade material does not retain an edge well at all. I was clearing brush at my range and after a while, it stopped cutting clean and turned into a blunt force tool. I could have used a bat or pipe just as effectively. If you're actually planning on using this, buy something else like a kershaw camp machete. If you need a prop for a halloween costume, buy this, cut with it a few times, the blade will dull to a harmless, useless edge.
customer_reviews.author: Misery

customer_reviews.title: BROKE in half!!!
customer_reviews.text: This machete BROKE while my son was using it. VERY unsafe. Not recommended at all!!!
customer_reviews.author: mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: SOG SOGfari 18" Machete
customer_reviews.text: This SOG SOGfari 18" Machete is dope. It was well worth the purchase and though I haven’t been in the thick of a jungle yet to have to use a machete without damaging the area too much, this definitely will come in handy. It’s great to have For back up purposes, is well made, sturdy and looks cool even for those who may collect different machetes or some type of blades. It’s packed away so I can’t post an image just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycoub

customer_reviews.title: CHOP it CUTit SAW it
customer_reviews.text: The packaging was adequate and delivery was prompt. Just as a quick test, I chopped some vines that were growing on the side of my domicile. It went through them like butter. I have not used the serrated edge as yet but I am sure the it will perform well. The balance is quite good for a blade this long. The stippling on the grip was a little slick for my taste. So I modified it slightly. 10 out of 10 on the scabbard. This SOG product lives up to the company's reputation. Highly recommended for anyone who thinks that they will need to CHOP something.
customer_reviews.author: MadMadWorld

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. We'll made.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter, a college junior , used this on a 3 week study abroad program for anthropology. She said she had to cut through jungle everyday and had no problem. When she returned home, I looked it over. It was dirty and had some tree sap on it. Cleaned right up and is ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: joe cedatol

customer_reviews.title: Got a good one.
customer_reviews.text: So after purchasing a slightly cheaper one from Amazon that broke after the first use i purchased this SOG. I am not easy on my machetes with a serious amount of shrubs to cut I use them a lot. So with 3 months worth of hard use I am surprised that it is still in one piece and it hold its edge very well. Did not come very sharp but can be easily sharpened out of the box. If/ when I need to replace this item it will be with the same one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert hogan

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.text: I saw the mixed reviews and wanted to give it an honest go. So after 2 years of minimal use on light brush around the house (wooded lot not a jungle or rain forest), this does not hold up. The metal is soft and the edge curls and chips. It is almost like a serrated edge blade now. Such a shame and disappointment from a company I thought put out a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Chops things that need to be chopped.
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality. Appears that it will Hold up well. Good texture on grip. Chops things that need to be chopped. Sheath leaves alot to be desired. Blade Not very sharp. Case cut easily by sissors when opening packaging / instantly proving the fabric is not "ballistic." White writing on side of case screaming the name brand (I blacked out with sharpie). To all companies reading this, I am not your advertisement, stop putting your name on my belongings.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Si

customer_reviews.title: Not very sharp
customer_reviews.text: I did have to sharpen it after receipt, but it's too light-weight to build up momentum for heavier tasks. Fine for VERY SOFT (grass-like) materials, or personal protection. This knife could not hack through a 1/4" twig with just one pass; I did use the saw on the back to finish the job, but then ... why not start with a saw in the first place?
customer_reviews.author: BSchauerte

customer_reviews.title: This thing is super sharp
customer_reviews.text: The kid went through a Walking Dead phase and he wanted a machete so we got him this one. It has never been used for anything but the handle is very comfortable and the blade is super sharp. It would definitely take care of a zombie with a well placed stroke.
customer_reviews.author: bears34

customer_reviews.title: Blade was made of poor materials
customer_reviews.text: The blade started falling apart after one day of use. The quality was just not there. I only used it on blackberry vines and it just started bending and cracking
customer_reviews.author: Sir. Rainbolt

customer_reviews.title: Blade too soft; it bends when you use it.
customer_reviews.text: When I first started using the Machete, I thought it was great. It cut through small branches coming out low on the tree trunk. I used it for about 30 minutes and when I went in to wipe the blade clean, I noticed that it had a series of dents on the blade. I figured is was hard steel, but it bent so easily, I think I'll send it back. I liked the feel of it and the sheath for protection. But the blade being so soft was truly a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS LIKE A CHAMP
customer_reviews.text: Needed one of these FOREVER to do yard work, cut weeds, roots and small branches- about same type price as big box stores, but i have held those and this one is much sturdier! it looks and feels like it will last for YEARS- i will keep you posted.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Great value, blade got a little wear from brush
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clear some tall brush in my backyard and carry this for hiking. It's a great tool. I've used it a lot and I'm only starting to notice some wear on the metal and nicks that require attention. The blade came sharp! It was so sharp that while it was shipping it cut through part of the sheath.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lemak

customer_reviews.title: Ok cutting tool. Doesn’t last very long.
customer_reviews.text: Nice cutting weight and good cutting edge. Doesn’t hold up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Theman

customer_reviews.title: If this tool held up like I thought it would I would have given it ...
customer_reviews.text: If this tool held up like I thought it would I would have given it 5 stars because this is a pretty sweet looking machete and not very expensive. BUT... I was testing this out in the woods and when I was chopping the blade bent and the a chunk of the blade actually broke off. This was in the first ten minutes of using it. I was pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Carter

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Very comfortable and secure grip grip. I live in VA where there are a ton of vines in the woods. With a little sharpening, it makes a great tool for cutting your way through. I bought three different machetes. I kept this one and a kukri one. The third and longest was returned. Longer wasn't better...
customer_reviews.author: Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sharp and strong!
customer_reviews.text: Factory sharpness is great, cut down an 8in in diameter pine tree in about 10mins. Easily clears out brush, looks nice and feels sturdy in hand. Sheath is pretty cheap and most likely won't last long but blade is quality.
customer_reviews.author: Will Bothwell

customer_reviews.title: It is very sharp and very sturdy. The only issue I found on it
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed apon arrival, for the price I was expecting something cheap, but I ordered based on the reviews. It is very sharp and very sturdy. The only issue I found on it, was when I was sharpening it, a small quarter of an inch of the metal was chipped towards the bottom of the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality and Well Balanced
customer_reviews.text: Much better overall quality than I expected. The machete is well balanced with enough weight forward to cut through some pretty heavy brush and the textured grip handle is a perfect, secure fit in my hand. It also arrived with a really nice sharp edge and it was ready to go right out of the package. This was my first time purchasing a SOG brand item but I will certainly buy more of their products now that I know the quality is there.
customer_reviews.author: G'Pa Dee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for elephant ears
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to quickly cut down elephant ears in the Fall. Great for the zombie apocalypse as well!
customer_reviews.author: Fellow Children's Book Author

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is a nice blade.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to take this blade out for major use; however, it appears to be very sturdy, and took an edge very well. The blade comes reasonably sharp, but after a few minutes on a sharpener it takes a very nice edge. I like to think that if I need to take this out into serious brush it would do the job. I will update if it ever fails me, but at this point, it meets all of my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: jcl1974

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact chopper. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Love mine. Fits under hood of snowmachine for chopping out branches while making trails. Added a wrist lanyard so if it slips out of slick gloves it dosent fly off into deep snow.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: A good backup truck blade, good for light weight chopping.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it feels decent. The paint has run marks from excess on many spots. The detail of the blade carved from the paint has a few rough spots in the line. It feels decent chopping through plants with about a 2-3 inch diameter, but something tells me not to risk it with much more
customer_reviews.author: W.Michael Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Danny Trejo approved!
customer_reviews.text: Great machete. Cheap, Sharp, easy to maintain, all the qualities of a good machete. Good weight and comfy grip, perfect for chopping your way through bamboo or splitting zombie heads open. I will say, after about 14 zombies it needs a good sharpening, but it can go through bamboo all day.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product for the price - it was a good balance of cost and function. Not the sharpest machete I have used, but it is very tough and handles the light weeks and shrubby over growth I deal with on my property.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I abused this thing for hours upon hours making a large clearing. I often used it as more of an axe to chop down smaller trees to test its durability and it withstood it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: quality item
customer_reviews.text: unlike most light weight budget machettes this this one is sturdy enough to do the job. sleath leaves a little to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: matthew demay

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp
customer_reviews.text: Careful, this is NOT your typical drugstore or sporting goods machete that comes with a butter knife dull blade. This thing is sharp, razor sharp. It will cut your fingers or hand or any other appendage I'm quite certain.
customer_reviews.author: J. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Guaranteed to break!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut brush in order to build ground blinds for hog hunting. I took it out the first hunt and it quickly shed a big chunk of the blade. I returned it and SOG sent me a new one. I paid $10 for shipping. I took it out again a couple weeks ago and guess what. Yes it broke again. This time it broke in two about six inches from the handle. I left it in the brush as I was not going to pay to for the shipping again. I recommend buying a better quality machete and save yourself the headache.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent machete. Very sharp out of the box and has maintained it's edge even after shopping down some mesquite branches that were definitely tough. Saw back works well as well.
customer_reviews.author: F.G.

customer_reviews.title: Only one problem
customer_reviews.text: Machete came out of the box sharp and has not had any major damage after chopping firewood, branches, or brush, (It has been about a year and a half since i bought it). Only issue is with the sheath, after a few months the saw began to cut through it, but it does come with a plastic guard to keep that from happening but i was to lazy to put it on. Use the guard and this is a great machete.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: SOG Solid!
customer_reviews.text: As with most SOG products this one shipped super-sharp and ready to use. Although a bit "top heavy" a great all-around garden tool for trimming and pruning and just general use. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This is a very dangerous item. The grip is a hard hard rubber, almost like a plastic and contains no finger grooves. it is slippery and awkward when holding and does not come with a wrist strap. I would never use this as full strength. Very uncomfortable to hold
customer_reviews.author: rdkmco

customer_reviews.title: A great machete
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my husband to clear brush on our property. He loves it. Works well. Protective sheath is a definite plus. Says its just the right size for the job. Any bigger would be too big. A++++++
customer_reviews.author: S. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Jason Vorhees Move Over!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my "End of the World As We Know It" stash, and I'm very happy that I purchased it. This came in the same order as my SOG F03T-N Jungle Primitive 15" knife, and I am very pleased with the quality of both SOG items. Even though it is a machete, it comes very sharp right out of the package (it can nearly shave arm hair!). There's also an awesome "saw" on the back side of the blade that can cut through tree limbs like hot butter. Whether you're using this for protection or general use, I have no doubt that this machete can fulfill your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Gustufson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic! This is the best machete I have ever ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! This is the best machete I have ever owned. The balance is perfect, the weight satisfying, the look, sexy! I will definitely be looking at SOG for more of my gear.
customer_reviews.author: Freewynd

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely incredible. I was cutting down 3 inch saplings ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely incredible. I was cutting down 3 inch saplings with EASE! I am so impressed that I will be ordering another one ASAP!
customer_reviews.author: mullyb27

customer_reviews.title: Another fine product from SOG
customer_reviews.text: Another fine product from SOG! I've taken this out to the bush a handful of times in the years I've had this and it continues to take out brush with no problem. Only had to sharpen once so far
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Just a cut above!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to beat for the money. Every "GO-BAG" should have one. Nice weight, nice length, fair balance. It is very sharp out of the box, but as of right now, I don't know how well it keeps an edge.
customer_reviews.author: E. T. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: great machete
customer_reviews.text: No matter what you need a machete for, this will do the job. Well made and a great value
customer_reviews.author: Walter C. Bostwick

customer_reviews.title: Works for me !
customer_reviews.text: Cleared the tail to my boat No Problem, no nicks in the blade, no cracking in half, no issues as of yet Did what it had to do ! The 18" blade is rather large ! very easy to wack it across the ground or objects not meant to be cut, would have gone with a smaller on blade if I knew, just have to be extra careful, I LIKE It!
customer_reviews.author: Springer

customer_reviews.title: Love this blade!
customer_reviews.text: I love this jungle cutter. Clear out an overgrown yard or sticker bushes real quick. Carve your own path in the forest if you want.
customer_reviews.author: xero gravity

customer_reviews.title: Great looking machete
customer_reviews.text: I use this baby for cutting ivy (year round in CA) -- it is durable and tough on ivy --which is brutal on weed wackers. I am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Holms

customer_reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up
customer_reviews.text: 👍👍exactly what I ordered. Well built and it even came with a sleeve that I thought was extra. SCORE!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony p

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It is a great machete, but the sheath is not very good quality, and the blade tends to stick to the inside when removing it.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Gret blade
customer_reviews.text: Great Machete, blade and a saw on the top side. VERY sharp, use carefully and be safe
customer_reviews.author: cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Decent for really small jobs
customer_reviews.text: Not very durable. I was just clearing out minor brush (nothing super thick) and it bent in several places within 2 hours. Got what I paid for, I was still expecting a little bit better quality with the SOG name attached. They did tell me I could send it in for a replacement, but with the cost of shipping I might as well just buy a new one and I would have it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sharp
customer_reviews.text: Ive used my SOG a few times. You have to find the correct angle when swinging this and it cuts nicely. Not really meant for saplings.
customer_reviews.author: Giacomo A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Inexpensive Machete
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machete in January to do some brush clean-up. It works best for cutting weeds and soft woody type plants up to 1-1/2 inches but it is perfectly capable of cutting larger limbs and branches. The saw is not cut to precisely so it is definitely not made for bigger limbs; but it could come in handy for sure. I have a hard time believing all of the reviews that I have read on here about broken blades and faulty sheaths. For me, this item lives up to the S.O.G. standard that I have come to love and I would highly recommend this machete.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Good blade.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good Machete for trailblazing and clearing the way. I spend a lot of time sharpening this to keep it sharp after use. I, also, keep it oiled. Can't go wrong with this for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Zahir Ansari

customer_reviews.title: Best Machete I've owned so far, and the price is incredible.
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed by my new SOG machete! My last two were $9 cheapos, and lasted less than an hour before the handles fell off. This knife however, for only $13 is built tough. The metal goes all the way thru to the tang butt, and the rubber handle is molded on, it's not just two pcs of plastic riveted on to either side. I can't believe how quickly this machete will allow me to chop through a 6" tree limb, and how quickly it sliced my finger when I wasn't paying close attention. This is an awesome product, I would imagine I will purchase more SOG products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: DrumrPete

customer_reviews.title: Quality there is none it's junk
customer_reviews.text: Was not at all what I was expecting incredibly thin too light and too much play in the blade disappointed looks like I'm back in the market for a machete again
customer_reviews.author: Kan

customer_reviews.title: Brittle and Dangerous!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machete looking for something I could use for light brush clearing and yard work. The first few swings were very satisfactory as the machete came with a very nice edge. However, after maybe four swings the blade broke about 2/3 of the way down, just sheared right off. I did not hit any rocks, nor was I chopping thick wood. So, within three minutes of use I had a useless piece of junk that got thrown away. I have the tomahawk by SOG and it has been a very nice utility axe, but stay away from this machete... it is a waste of money, it is brittle and it is dangerous!!
customer_reviews.author: MassDad

customer_reviews.title: Good for nothing
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't cut ANYTHING, no matter how thin, not even fresh, green, 1/4 inch twigs. Completely utterly useless. Very disappointed. No idea why it is Amazon recommended?!
customer_reviews.author: jana

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far it cuts and hasn't broken...can't say the same with the belt loop. That broke with the first wearing. May update later if there is anything bad, but so far for the price and what I need it for, it works great clearing florida brush
customer_reviews.author: Red3M(.)com

customer_reviews.title: You feel like John Rambo
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad knife for the money. Your not going to hack down a 50 foot tree but works well for vines and weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Surprised at the quality!
customer_reviews.text: The blade is much bigger than I imagined. The handle is comfortable to grip and the blade is weighted perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Petty P

customer_reviews.title: It's  a sog!
customer_reviews.text: Good. value for money! Easy to use I had to chop weeds all morning!
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Schwindt

customer_reviews.title: Great tool! Weighted well - tip heavy for extra ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tool! Weighted well - tip heavy for extra chopping power. So far the edge has held up well. Chopped through small 2 inch trees with a few whacks, like the grip of the handle as well. If the handle had a little more angle towards the blade it would really make for an easy hold, but not a real issue. Also like the steel on the bottom of the handle although I'm not sure what I'll use it for just yet. In a survival situation it could come in handy for pounding things I'm sure. Great buy for the money and the sheath is sturdy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sergeant

customer_reviews.title: Great weight and strength.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect weight. Strong as hell. Sliced right through the bushes and weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Healthycell

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I used it for about 2 hours and it has two large curved spots in it. Not meant for serious use. Maybe it would hold up to trimming weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tignor

customer_reviews.title: Nice sheath and good construction of a poor design.
customer_reviews.text: Decent blade, I used it on a recent trip through the back country of the North Cascades. Then I gave it away, if that says anything. The handle is really thin and awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Burnabout

customer_reviews.title: Machete
customer_reviews.text: I started taking my son camping. Handy to clean a small area, cut roasting sticks, etc. I like the case, both it and the Fiskars axe have on them. My son is almost 4, I’m sure everyone knows the benefits.
customer_reviews.author: Lee1982

customer_reviews.title: great machete
customer_reviews.text: usually cant go wrong with SOG, mine has worked like a champ, i know some people had issues but for light to medium duty it works great,no issues at all
customer_reviews.author: Flyin94

customer_reviews.title: brittle blade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this SOG machete for clearing small trees and wisteria vines from my backyard. On the first day of use, I wound up with a half-nickel-sized gap in the cutting edge of the blade. I should have purchased (and ultimately did buy) the Ka-Bar machete. Another thing--there are hard plastic serrations across the very bottom of the handle, which over the course of a couple of hours on a hot day wound up gouging my palm a few of times. I do not recommend this tool. Spend the extra money. Get the Ka-Bar machete.
customer_reviews.author: Zero Ego

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Sharp right out of the package
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Sharp right out of the package! As soon as I got it I cut and trimmed all the bushes and trees in my yard - like butter. The sheath is great with only one drawback: The hard lining doesnt cover the seem at the opening, so you have to be careful not to fray it with the sawback. Overall great machete
customer_reviews.author: David Huddleston

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and well made
customer_reviews.text: I work on a farm so I got this to help on the job. I did need to sharpen it upon arrival. Its held up very well and does what i need it to do. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha Wian

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend loves this for clearing out blackberry bushes and hiking
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Baxter

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE! ... This is a "real steel" machete/saw combo!
customer_reviews.text: I expected a piece of junk. What I got was fantastic for the money. This is a REAL machete. It has a great, sharp blade made of steel. It holds an edge like a much more expensive knife. I expected the saw to be just stamped triangles on the edge. It has sharpened, offset teeth that are wide enough and large enough to cut like a rip saw. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: jayne

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool to have around camp
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would need a machete for desert camping but I brought this along anyway. Very happy I did. We were using this for all sorts of things. It has a nice solid feel with a comfortable handle. The blade if fairly sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Akuhead Mumblecrust

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and comfortable in the hand seems a little front heavy
customer_reviews.text: lightweight and comfortable in the hand seems a little front heavy, more so then usual, but still pretty well balanced. like it alot
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 13" sogfari to make it easier to carry around while camping / hiking. I got to use it over a 4 day camping trip over the summer, it stood up well the first 3 days but the last day the blade started to warp, it still stayed very sharp but has what looks like dents in the blade due to extended use. I would purchase this again in a heartbeat due to the price. Their site says they have a warranty on the blade, I contacted Sogfari with pictures but my emails went unanswered.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny V.

customer_reviews.title: Badass Machete!
customer_reviews.text: Like the title says. Before buying I read mixed reviews and was reluctant after the purchase. I did recieve the SOGfari soon with fast shipping. I was surprised at how badass this machete is! It has a solid handle and a nice sheath to wear on the side or fit in a backpack easily and safely. This is not a hatchet! If you use it primarly for overgrown sticker bushes, weeds, and trail brush it will be your best friend on the trail hiking or camping. This will get you in and out of the bush. It is also great protection agaisnt critters, snakes and intruders. You can't beat the price either.
customer_reviews.author: JerryKNY

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy product - Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Use it at my property. Love the utility and the looks of it.
customer_reviews.author: PLG

customer_reviews.title: SOG: get rid of the saw-back!
customer_reviews.text: WAAAH! I tried to chop down a giant redwood with it and it chipped! Seriously, it is stainless. That means brittle and hard to sharpen. I love the handle on this and the SOG Kukri I bought. I wish there was no saw-back. I have no use for it, and it makes the blade stick in the sheath. I am going to tape over it with black duct tape.
customer_reviews.author: twitterisfortwits

customer_reviews.title: It is nice but I have others That are much stronger and ...
customer_reviews.text: It is nice but I have others That are much stronger and better quality. I guess for the price it is fine but you would expect a little more from SOG
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality but works great for things in my back yard. Just don't take it to the Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Houston

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: The machete is well made with solid materials. The sheath is nice. The blade was quite dull upon arrival, but sharpened up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsman

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Feels solid and Looks awesome. Not sure how it works in brush as I got it strictly for the zombie apocalypse.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. Haven't had this in the woods. So the sheath belt loop has ripped already. Don't even know how. (1-14-2018) OK. Chopped a few saplings just now and they need to be small. My 2 star review still stands.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: good deal, not as good as the one I ...
customer_reviews.text: good deal , not as good as the one I got last year--you have to sharpen more
customer_reviews.author: jebaseminole

customer_reviews.title: It's a good machete to buy for women who like 2 go out in the woods
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my girlfriend and it is perfect for her it is light contact and very well made
customer_reviews.author: Jerrod

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS MACHETE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Machete to take up in the Mountains in Wyoming. I have used a Machete for about 20 years and this is the first I've had to buy since 1990's. On the first Strike it actually tore the blade where I hit the branch. It was a branch that was 1/2" thick. The saw works decent and the grip is great. They need to rework the blade a ton and keep the other features.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Not as robust as expected...
customer_reviews.text: Likes: super sharp out of the box, good weight. Dislikes: After working on some light brush for about 2 hours, the blade edge is already bent in several places. Just expected it to hold up a little better. Was pretty inexpensive so get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Schon Williams

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: picked this up as an alternative to many of the other available longer blade machetes because it was important to get something that's not going to fall apart. although this item too is made in China, it does appear to be built fairly well. the sheathe is practical but features a design flaw (the securing tab should be relocated away from the blade's path). good item for the money (although price is climbing, picked this up for $18) and especially considering most of the competition does not feature solid handle structure.
customer_reviews.author: Alfio S. Saitta

customer_reviews.title: Like all SOG products I have used this is top ...
customer_reviews.text: This Machete is really made well. I use it for weeds, branches, small trees camping, etc. Like all SOG products I have used this is top notch!
customer_reviews.author: Icekrusher

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: It bends when you use it to clear out some tougher brush but over all its pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Glen 2021

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: Good machete great price needs a backstrap I installed a par cord one but would be nice to have on the machete
customer_reviews.author: nikkiB

customer_reviews.title: Nice blade
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, solid blade. Window breaker on handle. Saw blade very sharp as well. Cuts wood nicely. Sheath is OK, but belt loop leaves something to be desired.
customer_reviews.author: unhappy biker

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on other SOG products that I own and have had good success with. Took it out on a camping trip and took a few whacks with it. <TING> Blade snapped right in half after just a few swings. Might be good against the zombies if it's all you had and your life didn't depend on it. As for your battle with nature, the SOGfari caught a beat down. Don't waste the cash. Amazon was great and replaced it quickly, but the SOGfari has been benched until I'm up 40 zip against the undead.
customer_reviews.author: bdwickett

customer_reviews.title: Zombie Hunters
customer_reviews.text: Still Like New, Love The Look And Blades Are Really Sharp After A Few Swipes On The Sharpener....
customer_reviews.author: Orlando Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the dollar. Shouldn't take on crazy expedition.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first SOG product that didn't get a full five stars. The material and construction is awesome, but the blade nics and bends a bit too easily. That said, I would re-purchase the machete. I've used this for camping as well as clearing vines/hedges.
customer_reviews.author: Hip Dwayne

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Handle is nice, balance is fine. Initial quality of item is great. We shall see after a summer of yardwork.
customer_reviews.author: ThunderMug

customer_reviews.title: Sog makes quality items.
customer_reviews.text: Saw and sharp machete in one. Great handle and survival tool staple.
customer_reviews.author: rhza1

customer_reviews.title: I've swung a lot of machetes and was worried that ...
customer_reviews.text: I've swung a lot of machetes and was worried that it would be stout enough and hold a edge for heavy duty, rough work. Don't be.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lupton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Machete
customer_reviews.text: Love it! It wacks bushes and small limbs wonderfully and is well constructed and balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Cicero Brian

customer_reviews.title: This is a great blade, easy to hang on to
customer_reviews.text: This is a great blade, easy to hang on to, and is very handy to have in the Jeep on the trail and camping. Over the summer I've managed to get a few dents in the edge. But overall good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: it great, light but effective for brush & vines on ...
customer_reviews.text: it great , light but effective for brush & vines on the fence around the yard
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Lewis

product_meta.title: SOG SOGfari 18" Machete MC02-N - Hardcased Black Blade w/Saw Back, Rubber Handle, Nylon Sheath
product_meta.description:
Size:18-InchThe SOG Specialty Knives & Tools MC02-N SOG Fari features a real working saw on the back of the blade and is one of the most useful tools in the world, having cleared brush, blazed trails, chopped wood, made shelters and helped harvest crops. Made of 3CR13 steel with an attractive black powder coated finish, the 18-inch saw back with a fixed blade has a machete shape that can be used for survival exploration and clearing trails. The ergonomically contoured and well balanced handle has a black finish and is made of Craton to comfortably fit in your hand. The handle’s synthetic rubber material provides a no-slip surface with increased heat resistance, weathering and chemical resistance. There's a lanyard hole on the base of the handle. A black nylon sheath is included with a hook and loop closure and belt loop attachment to keep the safely protected and close to you at all times. This knife has an overall length of 24-inches, blade thickness of 0. 08-inches and weight of 15. 7-ounces. The SOG Specialty Knives & Tools MC02-N Machete with 18-Inch Dual Steel Straight Edge and Saw Blade comes with a limited lifetime that protects against defects in manufacturing and materials. Each SOG product is created with the help of company founder and chief engineer, Spencer Frazer. Known for their uncompromising style and performance, these knives and tools showcase innovation, dependability and a unique, futuristic style that has garnered awards and recognition worldwide. SOG products have also won favor among law enforcement, military and industrial customers that rely on their tools to perform flawlessly in the toughest, most adverse conditions.

AMAZON.COM


The SOGfari 18-inch machete (model MC-02) is an exciting addition to the SOG Specialty Knives and Tools family. Machetes are one of the more useful edged tools in the world, perfect for clearing brush, blazing trails, chopping wood, harvesting crops, making shelters, preparing meals, and more. Careful attention has been given to the SOGFari to make sure that the weight was right and the handles were comfortable for extended use. Whip it through the air and hear it sing. 

The go-to tool for survival, exploration and adventure (view larger). SOG has added a real working saw on the back of the blades with teeth that cut deep. Extended out of the back of the handle is a spiked tang for pounding and scraping. There are even holes in the handle to mount lanyards. All SOG products are guaranteed against defects in workmanship and materials for the life of the original purchaser. 

Specifications Blade length 18 x 0.8 inches Overall length 29.95 inches Weight 15.7 ounces Steel 3CR13 stainless Edge Straight and saw back HRC 52-53 Finish Black powder coated Handle Kraton WHAT'S IN THE BOX
MC-02 SOGfari 18-inch machete, nylon sheath

Kraton rubber handle (view larger). Includes nylon sheath (view larger). MC-02 SOGFARI 18-INCH MACHETE
AT A GLANCE:
 * Clear trails and brush, chop wood, and more
   
   
 * 18-inch high carbon steel blade with saw back
   
   
 * Kraton rubber handle 
   
   
 * Includes nylon sheath
   
   
 * Limited lifetime warranty



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
These machetes are exciting additions to the SOG family. Machetes are one of the more useful edged tools in the world. They have cleared brush, and blazed trails, have chopped wood, made shelters, harvested crops, prepared meals, hunted and protected. Careful attention has been given to the SOGFari to make sure that the weight was right and the handles were comfortable for extended use. Whip them through the air and hear them sing. We've added a real working saw on the back of the blades with teeth that cut deep. Extended out of the back of the handle is a spiked tang for pounding and scraping. There are even holes in the handle to mount lanyards.
